casebody.data:
State ex rel. UTILITIES COMN
v.
CP&L. No. 649A03. Supreme Court of North Carolina. January 8, 2004. Leonard G. Green, Assistant Attorney General, for Roy Cooper. James P. West, Raleigh, for Carolina Utility Customers Assn. Ralph McDonald, Raleigh, for Carolina Industrial Groups. Michael S. Colo, Rocky Mount, Thomas R. West, Raleigh, for North Carolina Municipal Power Agency Number 1 and North Carolina Eastern Municipal Power Agency, Inc. Edward S. Finley, Jr., Len S. Anthony, Raleigh, William Larry Porter, Charlotte, Kodwo Ghartey-Tagoe, for CP&L, Duke Power., NCEMC. Robert B. Schwentker, Thomas K. Austin, Raleigh, for North Carolina Electric Membership Corporation.

Prior report: ___ N.C.App. ___, 588 S.E.2d 77.

Motion by Appellants (Public Staff-North Carolina Utilities Commission and Roy Cooper) for Temporary Stay has been filed and the following order entered:

"Motion Denied by order of the Court in conference this the 8th day of January 2004."
